result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Wayne Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
6 YEARS initial confinement.  99 days credit.    DEF eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Concurrent with: Concurrent to 12CF78 and 21CF132

superMiscConds.notes: Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.

$518.00  including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Wayne Martin

records.addlTxt: Letters from DOC staff to Court regarding Sentence Credit

8:21 AM Defendant Edward Wayne Martin appeared by video, in custody.   Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Edward Wayne Martin. Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Novack indicates agreement has been reached, court moves to plea/sentencing.   State recites agreement.  State requests Court to amend Count 1, by removing the enhancer.  Court moves to Amend Count 1.  All parties agree with agreement.  Plea Questionnaire filed with the Court.  Court addresses the DEF regarding the right to appear in the courtroom and have Attny present, DEF agrees to proceed remotely and appearing by video.   DEF enters NC Plea to Amended Count 1.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.    Court accepts plea to Amended Count 1, and finds DEF guilty.  Count 2 is Dismissed and read in.   State makes statement prior to sentencing.   Attny Novack makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF no comment.  Court addresses DEF.  Court to follow agreement.    Jury Trial removed from calendar.  


COURT:  8 years state prison.  6 years initial confinement.  2 years extended supervision.   Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Complete any and all programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.  Court costs, including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.   Concurrent to 12CF78 and 21CF132.     Credit 100 days.   DEF eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

OFF THE RECORD / 10:14 AM Defendant Edward Wayne Martin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by phone. Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attny Novack request adjournment.  Discussion takes place.  Court reset.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Final pre-trial on June 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Final pre-trial on May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:06 AM Defendant Edward Wayne Martin in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Edward Wayne Martin in custody appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Novack acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.   Attny Novack indicates DEF requests speedy trial demand.   State requests 2-days.   10:11 AM  OFF THE RECORD:   Court to discuss dates with JA.    10:13 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD:   Attny Novack makes statement.    Court sets jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:48 PM Defendant Edward Wayne Martin in court, appearing in person while in custody, with attorney Renee M Taber.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Taber indicates proceed with prelim.  2:48PM State calls witness, DET Jay Poplin.  Court swears in witness.  State questions witness.  2:52PM Witness identifies DEF.  State tenders witness.  2:49PM Atty Taber cross examines witness.  2:54PM State objects - calls for speculation.  Atty Taber rephrases question.  State objects - speculation.  Atty Taber adds additional wording to question.  DEF responds.  2:58PM Atty Taber tenders witness.  State has no additional witnesses.  Atty Taber has no witnesses or argument.  Court finds PC, binds DEF over, sets ARGN on 4/12/22 at 10:00AM.  Arraignment scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

02:39 PM Defendant Edward Wayne Martin in court with attorney Renee M Taber.  Defendant Edward Wayne Martin in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Attny Taber enters NG Plea to Count 2.   Attny Taber request preliminary hearing to be set.  Court sets.   Bond Continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

10:40 AM  Defendant Edward Martin in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Alysja Otten (special appearance) appear in court by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Probable Cause found by court. DE does  qualify for PD appointment, but conflict with office.  State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Otten argues bond.  Court sets bond.  CBS $5000    ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.  INITIAL APPEARANCE set for  March 8, 2022 @ 8:30 AM
